## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been looking into the Verus DeFi testnet and I have to say, I'm a bit confused. What's the point of the Verus DeFi testnet if it's just a centralized platform with a single entity controlling all the assets and currencies?

**AI Assistant:**
I think there's been a misunderstanding! The Verus DeFi testnet is not a centralized platform. It's a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake, available worldwide, and running all the new Verus protocols being tested and hardened for mainnet. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have no value and may be reset at any time for testing purposes. It's a platform for developers and users to test and experiment with the new features and protocols before they're released on the mainnet.

**User:**
But how can I use the Verus DeFi testnet if I need to purchase the testnet currencies with real money? That seems counterintuitive.

**AI Assistant:**
You don't need to purchase testnet currencies with real money. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and are only for testing purposes. If you want to try out the new protocols, you can ask for a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies in the #pbaas-development channel on the Verus Discord. We're happy to provide you with the resources you need to test and experiment with the platform.

**User:**
Okay, that makes sense. But I've been reading about 51% hash-attacks and I'm worried about the security of the testnet. Is the Verus DeFi testnet vulnerable to 51% hash-attacks?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the Verus DeFi testnet is not vulnerable to 51% hash-attacks. It uses a 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm, which ensures the security and integrity of the network. You can rest assured that the testnet is designed to be secure and resistant to such attacks, so you can focus on testing and experimenting with the new features and protocols.

The Verus DeFi testnet is not a centralized platform. It's a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake, available worldwide, and running all the new Verus protocols being tested and hardened for mainnet. ## The New Verus DeFi Testnet
This is the most groundbreaking testnet the Verus project has ever announced, and we believe it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry. There are truly so many new capabilities and blockchain firsts working now on testnet that it’s hard to adequately cover them all. Below is a list of new capabilities active on the v0.7.2 testnet that will be on mainnet in the near future when considered fully hardened, tested, and ready for worldwide, public scale. Until then, Verus testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake, worldwide availability, and is running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet. If you would like a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies that you can use to try out all of the new protocols from anywhere in the world, simply visit the Verus Discord and ask in the #pbaas-development channel. You can use this link as an invite to the Verus Discord: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf- **DeFi and cross-currency liquidity integrated with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm** - This is a massive set of platform capabilities that take DeFi further than any project in crypto today. We will list it here and describe it below. Using it is simple. Understanding the implications of what such a protocol can do when rent free and integrated in a truly decentralized public blockchain is a process of realizations that is likely to be similar to layers of an onion. We will do our best to explain below.
